individual_metadata.synopsis: The InParty for Gale while in END_Main.Morphic Pool (Arrival)Astral Plane (Just after Netherbrain Confrontation)Tadpole Choice (with Emperor in Astral Plane while making the choice to transform into a mind flayer. Gale can be the mind flayer)High Hall Interior (after Astral Plane, views of Nautiloids, Dragons, and a city in ruin)

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: I can't talk when we have a city to save, darling.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: At least the bits of it that are worth saving.

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: Whatever you decide, do not delay for too long. Every moment we hesitate, the Crown may slip further out of reach.

22.speaker: Jaheira
22.text: You know, this might be the easy part. No planning. No doubt. Just the impossible task ahead - so try to have a little fun, yes?
22.context: NodeContext: Gallows cheer - the odds are against us, but all we can do is fight now

23.speaker: Jaheira
23.text: Come! We'll never bring the Brain low, trapped down here like fledgling chicks.
23.context: NodeContext: Brief pause in battle, urging us to get higher so we can attack the Brain that hovers above the city

38.speaker: Karlach
38.text: Lead on, soldier. This nasty hole has nothing on us.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Do we have time for one last kiss?

5.speaker: Karlach
5.text: Ah. What were we doing again?
5.context: NodeContext: Right after a kiss. Delirious with it, despite the stressful circumstances.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I'm a mind flayer now - how do you feel about that?

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: It should've been me, but what can I say? A few tentacles look good on you.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: How do you feel about being a mind flayer now?

59.speaker: Karlach
59.text: I didn't know there was so much me beyond myself.

47.speaker: Karlach
47.text: And I didn't know I had a chance at life - more life. I'm so... happy.
47.context: NodeContext: Sincere, but maybe a little detached since she's now a mind flayer

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Are you hanging in there all right?

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: Fuck yes, soldier. I'm burning hard and fast - and ready to fight a big old brain.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: Barely awake a moment, and the prince of the githyanki demands you surrender your soul?
45.context: NodeContext: Serious, this is a big decision

49.speaker: Astarion
49.text: All right, we can do this. We have to do this.
49.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn line] Psyching himself up

66.speaker: Karlach
66.text: This is wild. I'm myself, but... but more.

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: It's like I'm beyond myself. I can sense things I never knew were there...

30.speaker: Karlach
30.text: And my engine, it's... it's... silent.
30.context: NodeContext: Can't believe what she's feeling.

56.speaker: Karlach
56.text: No heat. No gears. Still there, but no longer threatening to explode. Soldier...

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Karlach - that means you're going to live!

1.speaker: Karlach
1.text: Yes. Yes! My gods - is it possible?

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: Shit. I'm gonna be all right. I get to be alive. I get to stay.
57.context: NodeContext: Karalch realizing she's going to live. She's excited and emotional, but is a mind flayer now, so less emotional than she would be if she was herself. They are more cerebral, stoic creatures.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: As a hideous monster, sure. But one that can feel. Think. Live.

61.speaker: Karlach
61.text: But I'm still myself. And I still love you. And, more than anything, I know what our mission is. Delighted I get to do the honours.

81.speaker: Lae'zel
81.text: I never thought I'd be happy to hear a ghaik will live. Yet my heart is very glad, Karlach.
81.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayer

72.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
72.text: I feel your mind evolving, Karlach... it is beautiful. You are more alive than ever.
72.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayer

68.speaker: Jaheira
68.text: Already at home in your new skin. They never took your heart, girl - they never even touched it.
68.context: NodeContext: Shaking head quietly, amused wonder / pride at Karlach's resilience.

16.speaker: Wyll
16.text: Oh, Karlach. No news could have made me happier in this house of horrors.
16.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayer

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: I'm glad for you, Karlach. It's hardly the life anyone dreams of, but, well... it's a life.
42.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayerNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayer. Arc: SH turned from Shar

37.speaker: Shadowheart
37.text: You'll have to face oblivion another time, it seems. I'm glad for you, if it's what you want.
37.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayerNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayer. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: I can imagine no finer ceremorph for the job.
52.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayer

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: I'm so pleased your mind survived the transformation intact. As for the rest of you... well, your mind survived and that's what matters.
14.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayerNodeContext: Astarion's pleased Karlach's surviving, although she has turned into a gross mind flayer, so...

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I'm so happy for you, Karlach. This is incredible.

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: It is. It is incredible. And I intend to celebrate - after we've defeated the brain.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: This is the first day of the rest of your life. Let's make it a good one.

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: I'll do you one better than good: Let's do something absolutely legendary.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: We've got a brain to defeat.

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: Let's finish this thing, soldier. It's time. And I'm ready if you are.

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: You are indomitable, aren't you? I'm so happy for you, Karlach.
19.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayerNodeContext: Genuinely impressed and very pleased for her

60.speaker: Minsc
60.text: Do you hear that, Boo!? Karlach lives! And this new form will make her all the slippier to grasp in our berserker bouts - a battle for another day.
60.context:
InternalNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayer.
Excited, then thoughtful, then getting back to excitement.

17.speaker: Halsin
17.text: A hard-earned chance at life. You deserve it, Karlach.
17.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach will live! Yay! But she is a mind flayer

39.speaker: Karlach
39.text: But I'm still myself. And I know what our mission is. I'm glad I get to do the honours.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Are you certain? Maybe your new form has just cooled it down for the moment.

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: This is something else. Something far deeper. Whatever ceremorphosis did to me, it... it fixed me.

48.speaker: Karlach
48.text: That means... I won't burn out.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I guess turning into an illithid has its perks.

79.speaker: Karlach
79.text: Here I thought I was making a sacrifice. Thank the gods I'm a noble fuck!

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I don't like the sound of that.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: Don't worry, soldier. It's still your old pal under all this purple. But suddenly 'I' am different than I ever knew.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: You look so different. I can hardly recognise you.

76.speaker: Karlach
76.text: I'm not surprised. But I've never felt more like myself.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I'm so grateful to you, my love.

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: You don't need to thank me. I somehow feel like... like this was meant for me.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: Maybe not the tentacles. But - you know. Bigger picture.

73.speaker: Karlach
73.text: Eyes ahead, soldier. We're nearly there.

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: I always dreamed of walking these halls, you know - enjoying the luxury of the ducal palace. And look at it now.
1.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Lord line] Last line with a smirk. He's feeling smug

4.speaker: Jaheira
4.text: You deserve a better end than shredding your soul for our sake. But then, this is not a matter of what is deserved.
4.context: NodeContext: Grim, does not like our decision to sacrifice ourselves and become a mind flayer - but knows it's our only option

16.speaker: Jaheira
16.text: Make your choice. Wherever it leads, we will follow.
16.context: NodeContext: Resignation - but she's trusted us this far, so she'll trust us a little longer

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: Such blazing wonder, to stand together and behold the sky swarming with red dragons. Listen close, and you can almost hear them roaring Queen Vlaakith's blessed name.

10.speaker: Halsin
10.text: All this devastation... but we shall prevail, my love. We shall vanquish this blight, and watch the healing unfold.
10.context: NodeContext: To love interest. Determined, In the final stages of the game's climax. Whole city in chaos.

11.speaker: Jaheira
11.text: How convenient - that the key to our salvation is the very corruption your illithid friend has been asking you to embrace all along.
11.context: NodeContext: Grim, dry, not believing a bit of it

15.speaker: Halsin
15.text: The end is upon us, my love. One last battle to decide all...
15.context: NodeContext: Spoken to love interest player, while in the climactic sequence of the game.

17.speaker: Halsin
17.text: Nothing remains for us here. Let us leave, and seek out the final reckoning.

7.speaker: Halsin
7.text: This is it, my friend. One last battle to decide all...
7.context: NodeContext: On the cusp of the climactic battle. Addressed to friend

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I need one last kiss, for luck.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I need one last kiss, for luck.

8.speaker: Halsin
8.text: Of course. But it shall not be the last...

5.speaker: Halsin
5.text: We shall triumph. Our time together does not end here.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: My new form - does it repulse you?

4.speaker: Halsin
4.text: The sight is unnatural, but I can look past the form, to the spirit within. You did this for all of us - I am indebted, not repulsed.

3.speaker: Halsin
3.text: With the end upon us? So long as I am surviving, and I have you by my side, I am faring as well as anyone can be.
3.context: NodeContext: to love interest player during the climactic sequence of the game.

2.speaker: Halsin
2.text: I know we can. Think of all that we've already survived. Our foes should quake to see us approach them.

13.speaker: Halsin
13.text: Victory eludes us, my love. But let us press on - the stones may have failed us, but this is not over while we still draw breath.
13.context: NodeContext: To love interest. Reacting to a false dawn - they haven't quite wom the day yet

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: Quite the choice you're faced with: surrender the Netherstones to a mind flayer, or surrender your soul and become one.
20.context: NodeContext: Serious, this is a big decision

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: If you need advice, I'll do my best - though I have to say I've not much to draw on in this case. It's rather a unique predicament to have landed yourself with.
63.context: NodeContext: Serious, this is a big decision

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Actually, that's not why I wanted to talk to you. It's about the orb...

91.speaker: Gale
91.text: The orb? Why ever would we need to talk about that?

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: I assure you it remains stable as ever, in spite of our encounter with the Netherbrain.

36.speaker: Gale
36.text: The Karsite Weave is primed for godhood, as soon as we have the Crown within our grasp.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Gale... I think we should consider using the orb as Mystra intended. To blow up the Netherbrain.

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: I stand here on the precipice of divinity - a course you encouraged me to pursue, I might add - and now you come to tell me to blow myself up?

76.speaker: Gale
76.text: I'm getting rather tired of how often those I care about seem to reach the same conclusion.

59.speaker: Gale
59.text: Even you - after the dreams we've shared.

44.speaker: Gale
44.text: Why exactly would I choose that course now, when I have so much to live for?

29.speaker: Player
29.text: We're facing a Netherbrain. Lose, and you'll never become a god anyway.

81.speaker: Gale
81.text: Pessimism like that is hardly going to improve our chances. But - I will begrudgingly admit that circumstances have somewhat changed.
81.context: NodeContext: Scoffing a bit, but reluctantly acknowledging you're not wrong

4.speaker: Gale
4.text: I still prefer my odds if I don't turn myself into a crater the size of the Lower City.
4.context: NodeContext: bit of an edge to it - pissed off that you suggested it

42.speaker: Gale
42.text: I sense your resolve falters, so allow me to provide some encouragement: we are not going to lose, and I am going to get that crown.
42.context: NodeContext: bit of an edge to it - pissed off that you suggested it

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: Now, let's drop the matter, before I feel obliged to detonate the orb just to put an end to the bloody business altogether.
28.context: NodeContext: bit of an edge to it - pissed off that you suggested it

94.speaker: Gale
94.text: As for your current predicament - it doesn't matter to me who holds the Netherstones, so long as they they are mine to claim once the brain is dispatched.

41.speaker: Gale
41.text: Beyond that, the choice is yours to make, and I wouldn't dare to impose myself on one faced with making such a sacrifice.
41.context: NodeContext: A bit snippy - making a point of not trying to convince the player as they just did with him

3.speaker: Player
3.text: You won't get the Crown from the Netherbrain without my help. I won't let you.

53.speaker: Gale
53.text: Come now - turning on each other will hardly improve our chances of survival.
53.context: NodeContext: hint of an eye roll - you're really trying that shit on me? a bit annoyed you tried

58.speaker: Gale
58.text: However, the sharpest tongues sometimes make the finest points. And your urgency is not unwarranted -  our circumstances have changed.
58.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - reluctantly accepting he needs to think more carefully on this

55.speaker: Gale
55.text: The elder brain was already a formidable foe, but the Netherbrain is on the cusp of achieving a godhood of its own.
55.context: NodeContext: The stakes of the matter - the netherbrain is nigh on unstoppable

82.speaker: Gale
82.text: Sacrificing myself to destroy it wasn't exactly the form of immortality I hoped for, but perhaps the time for hope has passed altogether. Now we need certainty.
82.context: NodeContext: trying to convince himself of this path, grim/gloomy as he comes to terms with it

18.speaker: Gale
18.text: So be it - I will be ready, whatever you decide.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: You're being selfish. You're risking all of our lives, our souls even - for the chance to make yourself immortal.

71.speaker: Gale
71.text: Is that not the very nature of chasing divinity?

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: The risk will be well worth the gain - we need only to hold our nerve through these final tribulations, and the crown will be ours. Everything will be ours.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: You're right. It's too late to change course now. We need to claim the crown.

26.speaker: Gale
26.text: Good. We'll put that little outburst down to the shock of the circumstances, and move swiftly on.

98.speaker: Gale
98.text: You'll soon have far greater things to be glad of - I promise you that.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: What do you think I should do?

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: As it stands, I see no option free of sacrifice in one form or another. So the question becomes - what are you willing to give up?

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: Relinquish the stones, and you place your fate in the hands of a creature whose trustworthiness is hardly guaranteed.

24.speaker: Gale
24.text: Keep the stones, and you relinquish the very essence of your being. Your soul, your emotions, your purpose. You would lose everything, and might live with such a loss for eternity.

110.speaker: Gale
110.text: All I can say is - whatever choice you make, if it leads us to taking the Crown it will be worth it. And I will ensure you are well taken care of.

24.speaker: Jaheira
24.text: I am the first to speak ill of this city. But I never wished to see it burning like this.

1.speaker: Jaheira
1.text: Come. We are not beaten yet.

27.speaker: Jaheira
27.text: Karlach deserves a better end than twisting herself into flayer-form. But then, she deserves a long life, too.
27.context: NodeContext: Grim, does not like Karlach's decision to sacrifice herself and become a mind flayer - but knows it's our only option

17.speaker: Jaheira
17.text: It is for her to make the choice, not I.

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: We've a city to save. I think it's about time we got started.

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: Fate seems determined to make a mindflayer of you, as it would make a cataclysm of me. Make your choice - the orb will be there regardless.

34.speaker: Minsc
34.text: To take on the flayer-form... There must be another way to defeat the brain, surely? If not - better we fight on anyway, and die beautiful!

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: So we can't wield the stones unless one of us becomes an illithid.

65.speaker: Astarion
65.text: I hope you're not actually considering this - we still have other options.

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: Why not let Karlach take the fall? She seems more than willing.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: Just consider the alternatives before throwing away that beautiful face or yours.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: Karlach seems willing to do it. It's not ideal, but there is a grim logic to it.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: Tell me you'll consider the alternatives? I don't want to lose you.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: More of an illithid, in your case.
8.context: NodeContext: Player is already partially illithid

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: Karlach offered herself. We could just let her take the fall. That'd certainly be the easiest option.

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: Karlach has offered herself. I can't say I love the idea, but... well, there is a cruel logic to it.

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: We could free the gith prince with the Orphic Hammer. Perhaps he'll have a bright idea.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: Maybe we should hand the stones over to the Emperor.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I'll do it. I'll become a mind flayer - I'm not afraid.

96.speaker: Astarion
96.text: I'm going to assume you meant that as a joke. I do not want you to transform into some slimy beast.

94.speaker: Astarion
94.text: We'll figure something else out, I - I'm sure of it.
94.context: NodeContext: Trying to be assertive, but faltering

87.speaker: Astarion
87.text: Of course you will. And of course you're not.
87.context: NodeContext: Said with a sad smile (Your love just said they'd sacrifice themselves and become a mind flayer.)

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: I wish I was surprised you'd volunteer, but I'm not. It's so perfectly... you.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: Really? Gods, all right. Better you than me.
72.context: NodeContext: Genuinely surprised the player's sacrfiicing themselves.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: Of course you're not. When have you ever been afraid of anything?

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: I don't think it's a good option, mind you. But we are all out of good options.

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: All right. If we're going to do this, then let's do this.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I spoke to Karlach already - I agreed to let her transform. This is what she wants.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I don't want this for Karlach. I won't allow it.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: I won't argue with you. She's scary enough as a tiefling - I hate to think what kind of mind flayer she'd make.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: But if you won't let Karlach do it, then the final decision is in your hands.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: I trust you with it. I just hope you know what you're doing.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Sacrifice Orpheus, sacrifice the githyanki people to an eternity of Vlaakith's tyranny. I will not allow it.

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: That narrows our choices a little, but all right. What will you allow?

31.speaker: Player
31.text: No one's turning into a mind flayer. We'll give the Emperor the stones.

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: That is a risky move. But if you think it's the right one...

86.speaker: Astarion
86.text: All right... Let's see how this plays out.
86.context: NodeContext: Thinking (needs to be a neutral tone, the previous lines could have been anxious or encouraged).

52.speaker: Player
52.text: We got that Hammer for a reason. We'll release Orpheus.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: A bold move. It's a gamble, but if we play this right, it could work well for us.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I'm not sure. What do you think?

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: You're asking me? Oh, darling, I don't know - flip a coin if you need to.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: If you won't allow the gith to suffer, then let Karlach do it. She's doomed anyway, so why not?

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: Personally, I'd let Karlach do it if she's so keen. She's doomed anyway, so why not?

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: Just don't you consider transforming. The tentacles won't suit you at all, darling.

97.speaker: Astarion
97.text: If you won't allow the gith to suffer, then I'll just have to trust you'll make the right decision.

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: Personally, I'd use the Hammer. Let Orpheus take the fall - what is he to us?

10.speaker: Astarion
10.text: However it lands, I'm sure you'll make the right choice.

91.speaker: Astarion
91.text: I'm fine with anything that keeps you from transforming into a mind flayer.

83.speaker: Astarion
83.text: I hate to say it, but if Karlach wants to do this, perhaps you should let her?

105.speaker: Astarion
105.text: But if Orpheus is off the table... well, I trust you to think of something.

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: Personally, I'd use the Hammer and take our chances with Orpheus. I'm most willing to lose him.

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: Although I understand if you feel differently about your 'prince'.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: But whatever you decide, I'm sure it'll be the right call.

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: Alas, you don't have any easy options.

40.speaker: Gale
40.text: If the path we tread were easy, there'd be a queue of fools willing to walk it. Alas, it isn't. And such grim choices must fall to us.

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: I trust you to know the course we must take. But my offer stands - if none wish to shoulder the illithid's burden, the orb would achieve the same ends.

61.speaker: Gale
61.text: There is, of course one more course to consider. The orb. None need shoulder the illithid's burden, if that is what you decide.

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: The brain is near. Let it be your one and only focus.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Perhaps we might share a kiss before our final stand?

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: No. First, the Netherbrain. Once it is fallen, we'll speak of the future beyond.

8.speaker: Lae'zel
8.text: You are my today. And should fate will it, my tomorrow.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: You must be disgusted with me, now that I look like a mind flayer.

81.speaker: Lae'zel
81.text: My instinct is to flay you where you stand.

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: But I am more than my instinct.

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: You made an incredible sacrifice - for me, for my people, for the Prince of the Comet.

57.speaker: Lae'zel
57.text: I know who you are, and I know what you gave up. You are the source of my bruises, the source of my joy, and more still: you are mla'ghir - 'liberator'.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: I know who you are, and I know what you gave up. You aren't illithid: you are mla'ghir - 'liberator'.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: As long as the Netherbrain lives, so must you. Yes, I see a ghaik before me. But I also see something more: victory.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: I am iron, steel, and silver. I am my Mother's blade. Ch'mar, zal'a Gith!

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: I am iron, steel, and silver. I am Vlaakith's blade. Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith!

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Are you ready to face the Netherbrain?

16.speaker: Lae'zel
16.text: The Prince of the Comet is fallen - and so I blaze a path to victory in his name.

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: Never again will my people suffer under illithid enslavement. Zai, zai, zai!
49.context: NodeContext: ZI, like eye! Battle cry of sorts, hyping herself up.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: I am. With the Prince of the Comet at our side, we will wreck the Netherbrain and its Grand Design.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: I am. Never again will my people suffer under illithid enslavement. Zai, zai, zai!
14.context: NodeContext: ZI, like eye! Battle cry of sorts, hyping herself up.

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: Let's be quick - our metaphorical clock is ticking.

74.speaker: Gale
74.text: Strolling these streets together would have been quite magical, in other circumstances. This is all a tad apocalyptic for my liking.

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: The Netherbrain believes it will rise victorious. But it could never predict the extent of our might and the heat of our fury.

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.text: Such blazing wonder, to stand together and behold the sky swarming with red dragons - they may roar Vlaakith's name, but I can't deny their beauty.

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: For this one moment, in this one battle, the lich queen and I share a common cause: the Netherbrain's defeat, and the Grand Design's failure.

14.speaker: Gale
14.text: It seems the brain's more reluctant to let go of the crown than we anticipated.

30.speaker: Gale
30.text: Separating the crown from that monstrosity will be harder than we imagined. It might be time to reconsider our strategy.
30.context: NodeContext: Cogs beginnign to whir. He might end up offering to blow himself up after this

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: You always pick the most romantic spots to chat.

67.speaker: Astarion
67.text: Anything on your mind? Impending doom, perhaps?

104.speaker: Player
104.text: This might be the end. I hate that I never got to kiss you.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: As do I. After all, forbidden fruit always tastes the sweetest.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: You'd just better survive this, because when it's done, we are going to find a way to taste each other.

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: Just think of it as motivation to survive. Because if we find a way to overcome this, we can find a way to overcome those spicy lips of yours.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: Come on, my love. Let's show them what we can do.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: This might be our last chance to share a kiss.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: This might be our last chance to share a kiss.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: Ha! Oh, my love. You can't expect me to kiss that now, can you?
6.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Lord line] It's funny, because the player is a monster now! ("That" referring to their face)

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: No, our kissing days are done, so let's focus on defeating the brain. Otherwise this whole mess will have been for nothing.
90.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Lord line] "this whole mess" again referring to the player's face.

85.speaker: Astarion
85.text: Oh - actually, I think the last time we kissed was our last chance to share a kiss.
85.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn line] Player asked for a kiss, but they're a mind flayer. Astarion trying to decline without being TOO rude

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: No offence, but... I mean, how would that even work now?
79.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn line] "how would kissing a mind flayer work"

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: Then we'd better make it count.

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: You've never tasted so sweet, darling.

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: We'd better survive this, because I never want to stop doing that.
9.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn line] "doing that" = Kissing the player

102.speaker: Player
102.text: How do you feel about my transformation?

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: I admit, I'm a little torn. You are repulsive, but just think of all the power you can access. It's a compelling mixture in an ally.

88.speaker: Astarion
88.text: I do miss your pretty face, though.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: It's certainly... different. It will take some getting used to.

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: I admit, I did love the person you were, but I understand why you made this choice.

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: Aside from my once-beautiful lover turning into a monster? Oh, wonderful.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: Oh, as well as can be expected when facing down the end of the world.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Do you think we can win this?

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: But of course! With my power and your tentacles, how could we lose?

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: I can't say. All I know is that by transforming, you've given us our best possible chance to survive this.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: Please, darling, you have the Vampire Ascendant on your side. How could we lose?

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: I can't say for sure, but we've come through a lot already. It would hardly do to fail now.

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: I always dreamed of walking these halls, you know.
98.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn line] A little wistfully

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: My dreams never included a giant brain or smouldering ruins, but I'll take what I can get.

106.speaker: Astarion
106.text: Look at this place. From a symbol of the city's power and grandeur to a brain-infested husk.

68.speaker: Astarion
68.text: Maybe I should help fund the repairs when this is all over. It would be the civic-minded thing to do.

108.speaker: Astarion
108.text: And it means we could install secret tunnels, spy holes, maybe even a murder pit. Everything we'd need to rule from the shadows.

0.speaker: Halsin
0.text: I had hoped the stones would have ensured our victory by now, but it was not to be. Let us press on - this is not over while we still draw breath.
0.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a false dawn - they haven't quite wom the day yet

2.speaker: Jaheira
2.text: You've made your choice - and us with you, Silvanus spare us. The princeling will save his people - just not in the way he imagined.
2.context: NodeContext: Grim resolve - we've decided to sacrifice Orpheus, allowing the Emperor to consume his brain so that we might have the power to defeat the Brain

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: High Hall. There's nowhere else to go... This is where it all ends, my love.
39.context: NodeContext: Spoken to love interest. Steeling her nerves/one last push.In high hall (an upper keep in the city - site of the final sequence of the game)

9.speaker: Jaheira
9.text: We do not know this Prince of the Comet - a thin thread on which to hang all of our hopes.
9.context: NodeContext: Frustrated shrug - we've decided to trust Orpheus at the eleventh hour

31.speaker: Gale
31.text: If you seek my input, you've only to ask.
31.context: NodeContext: Serious, this is a big decision

46.speaker: Gale
46.text: I confess, in my head I saw that going a lot less amicably. I hope our newly-freed ally proves more reliable than the last.

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: Fate seems determined to make a mindflayer of you. It remains your choice, as the crown remains mine.

57.speaker: Gale
57.text: The scent of Netheril hangs heavy in this place. The brain is close, as is the crown. I'm glad we face such a monster together.

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: The aura of Netheril hangs heavy in this place. The brain is close, as is the crown. As is victory, dare we begin to hope...

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I hope that wasn't our only chance. We must get hold of that crown.

86.speaker: Gale
86.text: Though I confess, the prospect of trying to outwit a brain the size of Mount Waterdeep is a challenge even for me.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: These could be our final moments. Time enough for a kiss.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: I hope that wasn't our last kiss. I'd take a thousand more if I could.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: How do you like my new look?

23.speaker: Gale
23.text: I'd be lying if I said it wouldn't take some getting used to, but what can a few extra tentacles do to a bond as strong as ours?
23.context: NodeContext: not overly bothered, takes it in his stride

101.speaker: Gale
101.text: When this is all over, we'll have time enough to unpick the specifics of your new condition. Psionics alone could take months to thoroughly evaluate, not to mention the matter of your diet -
101.context: NodeContext: Getting excited at the prospect of learning about your new form

103.speaker: Gale
103.text: But I'm getting ahead of myself. We've a Netherbrain to defeat. Then we get to the fun stuff.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: How do you feel about using the orb, if all else fails?

75.speaker: Player
75.text: We'll soon be close enough for you to use the orb. How are you feeling?

38.speaker: Gale
38.text: I'd need a ream of parchment longer than an elder brain's stem to capture the tumult I feel at that particular prospect.

109.speaker: Gale
109.text: But I'm ready, if that's the word you need to hear. If you call on me, I will not let you down.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: What will you do when we get hold of the crown?

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: 'When?' I'm glad you have such confidence in our endeavour. I confess, my own's not constructed from such immutable materials.

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: I made a promise to my goddess. One I will do my best to keep. For the sake of this city, I can only hope that my best will be enough.

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: I challenged my goddess, defied her will, and promised her destruction.

79.speaker: Gale
79.text: Fail to get the crown after all that, and if the embarrassment doesn't finish me off, Mystra might.

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: I don't dare to picture the crown in my hands - not when there's the small matter of an enormous, city-conquering brain beneath it.

84.speaker: Gale
84.text: But if, if, we overcome that obstacle, I will do everything.

32.speaker: Gale
32.text: I don't dare to imagine making such a decision when there's the small matter of the enormous brain beneath the crown still to overcome.

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: Ask me again when the illithid scourge has been wiped from this city, and I'll have an answer for you. Until then - it's best not to count on anything.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Do you think we stand a chance against the Netherbrain?

2.speaker: Gale
2.text: I'm cautiously optimistic. Though with the time left to us, and the amount still to be done, it's best we don't take anything for granted.

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: Who knows what shape these final moments of ours might assume? Not I. Not Mystra. Not even you. But whatever my fate might be, I'll be glad to greet it in such fine company.

83.speaker: Gale
83.text: You're okay - thank the heavens and hells and everything in between. I thought the brain would take you from me.

96.speaker: Gale
96.text: I'm not sure I ever considered the Emperor an ally, exactly, but even so, it's strange to know we're on our own at last.

104.speaker: Gale
104.text: The High Hall was once a beacon of promise, of wisdom, of celebration. Now... well , it's just a beacon, and for all manner of horrors. A pity.
104.context: NodeContext: Referring to the fact the high hall is on fire/wrecked

105.speaker: Gale
105.context: NodeContext: Mentally preparing himself for the prospect he might die when you face the brain
